title: Huge Labor Day sale at HP knocks up to 70% off laptops – see the 6 best deals right here
description: Great options for all budgets in the HP Labor Day sale
content:
If you're looking for a decent laptop for work, college, or just everyday browsing, you're in luck. The official HP Store has just launched its massive Labor Day sale, featuring some of the best prices I've seen this year on the brand's line-up of excellent laptops.

As TechRadar's deals editor, I've scanned through today's sale to find the best offers. In short, there's plenty to consider, and I've rounded up my six favorite laptops below – including everything from super-cheap everyday machines to high-end workhorses.

My choices start with this HP Laptop 15 for just $399 (was $739). It's not the cheapest machine available, but I think it's the best bang-for-the-buck option if you're on a budget, thanks to its speedy Ryzen 5 chipset.

Another fantastic buy is this 14-inch HP Laptop with a Core i5 and 16GB of RAM for $499 (was $699). That's a particularly good option if you want something relatively portable without breaking the bank.

Moving up in price, you'll find excellent options like the HP Pavilion 16 for $699 (was $979) and the HP OmniBook 7 for $879 (was $1,299). The price cuts are really hefty on these mid-to-upper range machines, and both pack enough power to handle more intensive applications.

If you're feeling particularly flush, you could even consider the stunning HP OmniBook X Flip for $899 (was $1,299), which not only features a stunning OLED display but also a handy 2-in-1 design that doubles as a tablet.

You can read more about these machines in more depth just down below.

More of today's best early Labor Day sales
• Appliances: 50% off major appliances at Best Buy
• DreamCloud: up to 60% off mattresses - deals from $399
• Helix: 20% off all mattresses with code LDW20
• Nectar: mattress deals from $349, up to 50% off
• Samsung: up to $1,500 off major appliances

keywords.name: todays best early Labor Day sales

summary: The official HP Store has launched a Labor Day sale featuring up to 70% discounts on its line-up of excellent laptops. The best deals include the HP Laptop 15 for $399 (was $739), a 14-inch laptop with a Core i5 and 16GB of RAM for $499, and the HP OmniBook 7 for $879. These machines range from affordable to high-end. The sale also includes discounts on major appliances at Best Buy and DreamCloud.
shortSummary: HP's massive Labor Day sale offers up to 70% off laptops, ranging from affordable to high-end, with extensive discounts including HP's Laptop 15.

Latest about OLED
The battle for the top OLED TV is more intense in 2025 – and this time it's not just about brightness
By James Davidson published
LG and Samsung have ruled the OLED TV roost in recent years, but Sony and Panasonic are more aggressively bringing the fight in 2025.
Panasonic Z95B review: a flagship OLED TV that combines refined pictures with powerful sound
By Al Griffin published
Panasonic's new flagship OLED TV provides a significant step-up in brightness, but it’s tuned for picture accuracy and has powerful built-in 5.1.2-channel sound.
Asus unveils ridiculously fast 720Hz gaming monitor – but it’s the Tandem OLED tech I’m interested in
By Isaiah Williams published
Gamescom 2025 is bringing plenty of surprises our way, and one of them is a brand new Tandem OLED monitor from Asus.
LG TVs are the first to get 4K 120Hz Nvidia GeForce NOW game streaming – anyone want RTX 5080 power without the cost?
By Carrie Marshall published
LG OLED TVs and monitors are getting a massive gaming upgrade
I compared Panasonic and Sony's 2025 OLED TVs to see which has the better sound – and there’s an obvious winner
By James Davidson published
Panasonic and Sony TVs have the best built-in sound on the market, but who comes out on top in a side-by-side test?
Best Labor Day TV sales 2025: today's best early deals from $69.99
By Mackenzie Frazier last updated
I'm rounding up today's best early Labor Day TV sales, which include record-low prices on 4K, QLED, and OLED displays, with prices starting at just $69.99.
Two OLED TV showdowns, very different results - here's what our casual viewers thought compared to TV experts
By James Davidson published
We conducted a blind OLED TV showdown with a panel of casual viewers, and the results were very different than a recent expert test.
I tested Panasonic and LG flagship OLED TVs side-by-side, and even though they use the same panel, the results were surprising
By James Davidson published
Both the Panasonic Z95B and LG G5 use the same new four-stack OLED panel, but I tested them and found differences.

Device models that currently qualify for trade-in and trade-in credit amounts associated with those models are available on Samsung.com and the Shop Samsung App; eligible models and amounts may change at Samsung’s sole discretion. To be eligible for trade-in, your qualifying device must meet all Trade-In Program eligibility requirements, which include, but are not limited to, that the device powers on, holds a charge, and does not power off unexpectedly; has a functioning display; has no breaks or cracks in the screen (unless a cracked screen offer applies); has no breaks or cracks in the case; has no liquid damage (whether visible or not); has no other defects that go beyond normal wear and tear; is not on a black list; has a verified FCC ID; has been reset to factory settings; has all personal information removed; has all software locks disabled; and is owned by you (leased devices are not eligible). Anticipated trade-in value will be applied as a credit at time of purchase, but, if you do not send in your trade-in device within 15 days of receipt of your Qualifying Purchase, you will be charged back for the trade-in credit applied to your purchase, or if you send in your trade-in device within 15 days of receipt of your Qualifying Purchase but Samsung determines your device does not meet all eligibility requirements, you will be charged back for the trade-in credit applied to your purchase minus $25. Participation in this program does not excuse you from contracts with your carrier or retailer (or any related payments or fees) for the device that was traded in. Limit 1 trade-in per Qualifying Purchase. Samsung reserves the right to modify or discontinue this offer at any time. argos_summary: The article spotlights HP’s Labor Day sale, featuring six laptops ranging from a $399 HP Laptop 15 with a Ryzen 5 chipset to a $899 HP OmniBook X Flip with OLED 2‑in‑1 design, all discounted from their original prices. It highlights budget‑friendly options such as the $499 14‑inch HP Laptop with Core i5 and 16 GB RAM, mid‑range models like the $699 HP Pavilion 16 and $879 HP OmniBook 7, and premium choices such as the $899 OmniBook X Flip. The piece also references additional HP coverage—including reviews of the EliteBook Ultra G1i, best HP laptops of 2025, and other HP deals—providing readers with deeper context and comparison points.
